page.title: 18Roman Wall Sheep Show
page.content: The Roman Wall Show is held every June and is the first of the local sheep shows. Farmers display their best sheep in the hope that they will win a cup, or even be named show champion, which is a great honour and a good excuse for a celebration. There is a hound trail and a sheep dog competition. For the children there are sports with small prizes, and for the really fit a strenuous race over the nearest fell. In a large tent homecraft skills are on display, the old art of stick dressing can be seen, as well as childrens artwork and handwriting. Hot dog stands and a beer tent provide refreshments when needed. Visitors find the show rather old fashioned but to local people it is a day to look forward to, a good chance to meet and gossip to friends.
